items.label: Open text file in a terminal editor from Thunar
Switch Git repository from HTTPS to SSH

intro.title: Welcome
intro.description: This will be the home page for my new website.

linux/Scripting/arch-maintanence.title: Arch Linux Maintenance
linux/Scripting/arch-maintanence.description: It's a good idea to keep your system well maintained. Arch has a wiki article in which they describe best practices on how to maintain your Arch system according to them.

linux/thunar-text-file.title: Open text file in a terminal editor from Thunar
linux/thunar-text-file.description: For some reason I like to use Thunar as a file manager. It's been my go-to for years now. It has worked a treat for ages, however I used to want to edit text files (like configuration files) in Code (the editor). I don't anymore. I want to be able to edit those files in Micro, which runs in the terminal.

software/Firefox/extensions.title: Extensions
software/Firefox/extensions.description: Extensions make your browsing experience better, or at least some extensions will. I will explain why I use each of the following and I'll try to convince you that you should at least try (some of) them for yourself. I'm going to list these worst-to-best, though they are all amazing in their own right.

software/Firefox/userChrome.title: userChrome.css
software/Firefox/userChrome.description: I use Firefox as my main web browser. I have been for decades. The only thing I really dislike about it is the total amount of space the UI takes up.

software/Git/http-to-ssg.title: Switch Git repository from HTTPS to SSH
software/Git/http-to-ssg.description: Sometimes you clone a repository because you just want to use whatever is in there. But you might end up contributing to that repository and you may need to access it over SSH now. You could just delete the entire local folder and grab it again using SSH, but you could also switch your HTTPS repo to an SSH one...
